author: newsr.in
title: Nokia’s Canceled Linux-Based “Pine” eReader Shows Up
text: Back in 2013, Microsoft acquired Finnish phone manufacturer Nokia, who has been struggling to maintain its business afloat for quite some time. Microsoft paid a pretty petty amount in order to bring Nokia into the fold, including design, manufacturing and distribution of both smart and feature phones and the right to license many of Nokia’s patents, as well as the right to use the Nokia name on a host of mobile services. But prior to the acquisition, Nokia might have ha... »
